plan1.condition: Patient experiences increased shortness of breath or O2 sat drops below 92%
plan1.action: Increase oxygen to 4L, obtain arterial blood gas, notify physician immediately, prepare for possible BiPAP

plan2.condition: Urine output decreases to less than 20ml/hr for 2 consecutive hours
plan2.action: Check catheter patency, review fluid balance, obtain creatinine and BUN, consider nephrology consult

plan3.condition: Blood pressure drops below 90/60 or patient shows signs of hypotension
plan3.action: Hold diuretics, fluid bolus 250ml NS, reassess in 30 minutes, notify attending physician
